page.title: 07A housewife's Monday
page.content: At 7-30am I get up,wash,dress,go downstairs,and prepare breakfast while Radio 4 broadcasts its usual message of doom and gloom.Undeterred,I rouse the reluctant risers.By 9am they have left for school (husband too!) and I spend the next hour doing the house- work. Between 10-30am and 3-30pm,I do voluntary work at the Arlais Road Day- Centre,serving meals and generally entertaining the aged.I return home in time to greet my family.We talk about what sort of day we've had,discuss any problems and share each other's worries whether real or imaginary. After the evening meal - husband does the washing-up - from 7pm to 9pm I am an evening-class tutor of French conversation at the F.E.College.What an exhausting,but rewarding day!I have certainly earned my warm,relaxing bath.Bonne nuit!Fais des beaux reves!
